metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6406 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The function ParseVP9SuperFrameIndex in common/libwebm_util.cc in libwebm through 2018-01-30 does not validate the child_frame_length data obtained from a .webm file, which allows remote attackers to cause an information leak or a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and later out-of-bounds write), or possibly have unspecified other impact.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> marking chromium-browser as ignored as we do full-version upgrades and we rely on upstream's bundled libwebm

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
